case_vignette: A mother brings her 4-year-old boy to the physician, as the boy has a 7-day history of foul-smelling diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and fever. The mother adds that he has been vomiting as well, and she is very much worried. The child is in daycare, and the mother endorses sick contacts with both family and friends. The boy has not been vaccinated as the parents do not think it is necessary. On physical exam, the child appears dehydrated. Stool examination is negative for blood cells, pus, and ova or parasites.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've had really bad-smelling diarrhea, tummy cramps, and a fever for a week, and I've been throwing up too.
Have you recently traveled or eaten anything unusual?
No, I haven't traveled or eaten anything unusual.
Have you had any contact with anyone who has similar symptoms or has been diagnosed with an infectious disease?
Yes, I've been around some family and friends who were sick.
Have you or the people around you who were sick recently been on antibiotics?
I don't know about the others, but I haven't been on antibiotics.
Are you experiencing any signs of dehydration such as dry mouth, decreased urination, or dizziness?
The doctor said I look dehydrated.
Do you have any past medical history of note, such as a chronic illness or immune system problems?
No, I don't have any chronic illnesses or problems with my immune system.
Have any of your sick contacts been diagnosed with a specific illness?
I don't know what specific illnesses they had.
Have you noticed any blood or mucus in your stool?
I haven't seen any blood or pus in my poo.
Is there a specific time of day when your symptoms are worse, or are they constant?
They don't really get worse at a specific time; it's more like all the time.
Do you have any allergies or are you pregnant?
I don't have any allergies and I'm not pregnant.
Are you currently taking any medications, over-the-counter or prescribed?
No, I'm not taking any medications.
Final Diagnosis: Gastroenteritis, likely infectious in nature.
